cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles SSE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts tonight, then forecast to turn north across Louisiana and Arkansas and sweep northeast across the Mid-Mississippi and Ohio Valleys this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas–Louisiana border between Port Arthur TX and Lake Charles LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Freeport TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River (Storm-surge watch areas farther east to Ocean Springs MS and Lake Pontchartrain)
weather_observation.warning_coast: San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA (hurricane) and adjoining Gulf Coast sections for storm-surge and tropical-storm warnings
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwest Gulf Coast of Texas and Louisiana, then inland across Louisiana, Arkansas, the Mid-South, and eventually the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (Detroit not in NHC wind-probability list)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No (Great Lakes freshwater port, no surge)
weather_observation.wind: Remnant system may bring occasional gusts below tropical-storm force (generally <39 mph) late Saturday into early Sunday
weather_observation.rainfall: 1-2 inches of rain possible as the remnants pass south and east of Detroit, causing brief ponding or minor urban runoff
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief thunderstorms with lightning; low risk of embedded weak tornadoes south of the port, but not expected directly at the port
